channel.title: Exp
channel.description: How do you change how much experience you get from closing doors, hitting dummies, and clicking on haybales.

item.title: Exp
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

He probably won’t have that exact thing, unless he has the same source as you. Just search “case 132:” Or “object click one” and look for the training objects, and change the addSkillXP you get.

Read full topic

item.title: Exp
item.dc:creator: @scootkid scootkid
item.description:
@scootkid wrote:

o This is an Easy one…
Simply hit whatever and see what message comes up
then search that message in your client.java
Here’s an example-

case 1531: if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("What The Fuck Man, You Broke My Door!"); actionTimer = 20; setAnimation(1658); addSkillXP((8500*playerLevel[2]), 2); addSkillXP((8500*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((8500*playerLevel[18]), 18); stillgfx(246, absY, absX); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;

case 1531: (That 1531 is whatever object your are using.) if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("What The Fuck Man, You Broke My Door!"); actionTimer = 20; HOW FAST YOU HIT setAnimation(1658); WHAT HAPPENS TO YOUR PLAYER addSkillXP((8500*playerLevel[2]), 2); HOW MUCH EXP IS GIVEN addSkillXP((8500*playerLevel[3]), 3); HOW MUCH EXP IS GIVEN addSkillXP((8500*playerLevel[18]), 18); HOW MUCH EXP IS GIVEN stillgfx(246, absY, absX); WHAT ANIMATION IT SENDS (SPELLS AND SUCH) updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;

Now in this line of code it shows-

addSkillXP((8500(HOW MUCH)*playerLevel[2])(WHICH SKILL), 2); HOW MUCH EXP IS GIVEN

HERE ARE ALL THE SKILLS AND THEIR NUMBERS-

public int playerAttack = 0; public int playerDefence = 1; public int playerStrength = 2; public int playerHitpoints = 3; public int playerRanged = 4; public int playerPrayer = 5; public int playerMagic = 6; public int playerCooking = 7; public int playerWoodcutting = 8; public int playerFletching = 9; public int playerFishing = 10; public int playerFiremaking = 11; public int playerCrafting = 12; public int playerSmithing = 13; public int playerMining = 14; public int playerHerblore = 15; public int playerAgility = 16; public int playerThieving = 17; public int playerSlayer = 18; public int playerFarming = 19; public int playerRunecrafting = 20;
You Can Find Your In Your Player.java File

Again, Hope This Helps… If You Have Any Problems Feel Free To Ask
YW AGAIN

Read full topic
